item.title: Microgames collection Dreams of Aether announced, now available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/04/microgames-collection-dreams-of-aether-announced-now-available

  • PC

Free for the first 24 hours of release.

Publisher Aether Studios and developer Lepioid have announced Dreams of Aether, a collection of “dozens” of Aether series-themed microgames. It is available now for PC via Steam completely free for the first 24 hours of release, after which it will cost $2.99.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Dreams of Aether is a short and sweet cluster of fast-paced, seconds-long microgames! Starring characters from all over Aether, from legendary figures like Zetterburn and Orcane, to the humble Pyrewing and Florpian. Punch, flap, and swing your way through the dubiously-canon story, and see how far you can get in endless modes!

Absa, the Storm Architect from the far-off Tempest Peak, finds herself trapped in an eternal dream world. And things are getting WEIRD! Why can’t she wake up? What’s with all of these out-of-body experiences? What’s this piñata doing here? Why am I asking YOU all these questions?

The Lore

Absa! She’s in this one! It’s not a fakeout!

Dan Fornace-approved, I think?

Key Features

  • Five stages of Aether-flavored microgames!
  • Go for high scores in endless modes of every stage!
  • A new original soundtrack directed by flashygoodness!
  • A smattering of unique art styles!
  • Laugh at the funny animals interacting! please
